properties.address: Kent County Council, Kent ME16 0PR
properties.description: Visit any of our libraries in Kent for a warm welcome. Browse our shelves, catch up with friends online with our free computer and WiFi access, or meet new people at one of our friendly social groups. Share a story, visit our cheery children's areas with little ones or pop along to one of our regular events. Many other services and partners also use libraries for drop-in surgeries.

properties.address: St. Justus Church, Kent ME1 2LT
properties.description: Community Cafe open to all. Tuesdays 10.30 to 12.30. Games, bingo, quiz, karaoke, puzzle library, refreshments available, onsite parking, level access from car park, disabled facilities, friendly social space.
properties.title: Cafe Plus

properties.address: Christ Church, Park Wood, Kent ME15 9JW
properties.description: A space for all ages to come and have a cup of coffee and some great company. Children are welcome and we have toys ready and waiting to be played with. As well as some games like parachutes and indoor snowball fights for them to join in with on occasion. For you adults come along and be a part of this amazing community, it's a very relaxed and welcoming environment. And if you want some time with just adults we have the break room from 13:30 - 14:30 which is adults only
properties.title: Celebration Church UK

properties.address: High Street, Strood, Rochester, Kent ME2 4TR
properties.description: Open from 02/12/2024 9:30am-1pm We have facilities for all ages. We have toys and will provide games, reading material etc. more suitable for older people. We will endeavour to cater for the needs of those who come. There is limited parking in the upper car park near the church. The Lower Car park is permit only and you could be fined if you park there.
properties.title: St Nicholas Strood

properties.description: Open from 1/11/23 All ages welcome with space for families with children We meet in our church hall, accessible down the side of the church.

properties.address: The Brassey Centre, Aylesford, Kent ME20 7BR
properties.description: A place of welcome where people can come for company, warmth and refreshment. There is no charge to attend. Just drop in Also information for local help groups, visits by local charities and community wardens at times Able to put in touch with social services, debt advisors etc as needed
properties.title: St Peter & St Pauls Community Hub Aylesford

properties.address: The Net Community Hub, Chatham, Kent ME5 0QX
properties.description: A welcoming community space for all to meet old friends and make news ones, especially those who may be lonely and isolated. We have some sessions for specific people but mostly open to all. Parking is on street, but no restrictions.
properties.title: The Net Community Hub
